docs.text:
dns4s is an implementation of the DNS protocol in Scala. It consists of the following parts:
Core Akka IO Extension Netty Codec
docs.title: dns4s

docs.text:
The core part contains the functionality used for en-/decoding of DNS messages as well as an inner-DSL to con-/destruct DNS messages.
For a detailed explanation of the DSL have a look at its documentation.
docs.title: Core

docs.text:
Use the following imports for the examples:
import com.github.mkroli.dns4s._
import com.github.mkroli.dns4s.dsl._
import com.github.mkroli.dns4s.section._
import com.github.mkroli.dns4s.section.resource._
docs.title: DSL

docs.text: The akka part contains an akka-io extension.
docs.title: Akka IO Extension

docs.text:
If you’re using sbt just add the following to your build definition:
resolvers += "bintray" at "http://jcenter.bintray.com"

libraryDependencies ++= Seq(
  "com.typesafe.akka" %% "akka-actor" % "2.4.12",
  "com.github.mkroli" %% "dns4s-akka" % "0.13.0")
docs.title: Usage

docs.text:
Use the following additional imports to get started:
import com.github.mkroli.dns4s.dsl._
import com.github.mkroli.dns4s.akka._
docs.title: Imports
Server
Client

docs.text: The netty part contains the MessageToMessageCodec DnsCodec.
docs.title: Netty Codec

docs.text:
If you’re using sbt just add the following to your build definition:
resolvers += "bintray" at "http://jcenter.bintray.com"

libraryDependencies ++= Seq(
  "com.github.mkroli" %% "dns4s-netty" % "0.13.0")
docs.title: Usage

docs.text:
Use the following additional imports to get started:
import com.github.mkroli.dns4s.dsl._
import com.github.mkroli.dns4s.netty._

import io.netty.util.concurrent.Future
docs.title: Imports
Server
Client
